page.title: 09Forestry around Rushmore
page.content: {Mr. Birt}lives in{South Lodge.}He told us that he looks after mainly{Beech, {Maple,Cherry,Hazel and Norway Spruce. The latter is the most common. The {Hazel is used for making hurdles,bean_ {rods,pea sticks and thatching spars. After consulting the{Forestry Commiss_ {ion}trees can be felled generally at {12 years old. The Spruce is used for {pit_props.}They plant more trees than they fell to conserve the countryside. {Squirrels like to strip the bark}and {rabbits and hares}do a lot of damage to young trees and natural seedlings. Some of the wood is turned into chips by a large machine supplied by the paper factory. He controls 150 acres and the oldest tree in his care is a{300 year old oak. They do not get much money until the trees are mature or semi-mature. {(AUTHOR:W.Wingfield Digby C.Birts) }
